results.title: House Votes to Renew Surveillance Law, Rejecting New Privacy Protections

results.title: That Recent Brutally Cold Weather? It’s Getting Rarer
results.abstract: With climate change warming the Arctic air, researchers say, cold snaps are getting warmer. The recent spell of cold was an outlier.

results.title: Walmart, Citing Tax Cuts, Will Raise Starting Wages and Expand Benefits

results.abstract: In an exchange with Dutch journalists, Peter Hoekstra declined to clarify his prior remarks. “This is the Netherlands, you have to answer questions,” one reporter said.

results.title: Finding the Oldest Fossils of Butterflies Using a Human Nose Hair
results.abstract: While studying ancient pollen in the black goop of sediment collected in Germany, researchers discovered 200 million-year-old butterfly scales.

multimedia.caption: A scanning electron mircoscope image of the body and wings of a proboscid-bearing moth that is covered densely with scales.

results.title: Tonya Harding Would Like Her Apology Now
results.abstract: In the movie, “I, Tonya,” the disgraced figure skater looks back on the 1994 Nancy Kerrigan scandal and her struggles to tell her side of the story.

multimedia.caption: What do we know about her? Tonya Harding, shown at Mountain View Ice Arena in Vancouver, Wash., is back in the spotlight and has a few things she would like to clear up.

results.title: Why Are Our Most Important Teachers Paid the Least?
results.abstract: Many preschool teachers live on the edge of financial ruin. Would improving their training — and their pay — improve outcomes for their students?

results.title: Brain Surgery in 3-D: Coming Soon to the Operating Theater
results.abstract: New “videomicroscopes” offer astounding images, helping surgeons perform and collaborate on delicate brain and spine operations.

multimedia.caption: A surgical team led by Dr. David Langer at Lenox Hill Hospital in Manhattan operated on arteries in the brain of Anita Roy of the Bronx. The surgeons used a videomicroscope, a novel device that puts a magnified, high-resolution 3-D image on a screen so that an entire team may see the progress of the operation.
multimedia.copyright: Beatrice de Gea for The New York Times
